column2: MICHIGAN DMV DRIVING TEST
Question Text
1. The first sign drivers see when approaching a highway-rail intersection is usually:
2. This sign indicates:
column4: Double curve ahead. Slow your speed.
column8: The road may be slippery when wet. Drive slowly.

column2: 3. When an aggressive driver confronts you, you should:
column6: Report aggressive drivers to law enforcement authorities.

column2: 4. This warning sign means:
column4: Slow down, drive with caution and watch for children
column6: Watch out for children crossing the street

column2: 5. Drivers should use the horn:
column4: if a driver is moving slowly, and you want them to drive faster.
column6: to alert other drivers that they made a mistake.
column10: only when necessary, to avoid collisions.

column2: 6. The driver of an emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can legally:
7. What is the main reason night driving is more difficult than daytime driving?
column4: The use of headlight is required by law.

column2: 8. To check your blind spot before changing lanes:
column4: look into the left side mirror.
column6: look into the right side mirror.
column8: look over your shoulder in the direction you plan to move.

column2: 9. A steady yellow light means that a ______ light will soon appear.
10. This sign indicates:
11. If a bus has signaled and is pulling back onto the roadway, you must:
column4: honk to let them know you’re there.

column2: 12. Most signs used in street work areas are:
13. This road sign means:
column10: Divided highway ahead - stay to the right

column2: 14. This road sign means:
column6: Right turn permitted on red light

column2: 15. Parking is not allowed:
column4: on the road side of a parked vehicle.

column2: 16. From top to bottom, traffic lights are:
17. If you get on a wrong expressway exit, you must:
column4: get off at the next exit and look for signs that tell you how to return to the expressway.
column6: drive in reverse to return to the expressway.
column8: make a U-turn and return to the expressway.
column10: use the the exit ramp to accelerate to expressway speed and blend with traffic.

column2: 18. This road sign means:
19. These are:
20. When they see a crossbuck sign, drivers:
column4: must always come to a complete stop.
column6: must slow down and wait for the red lights to flash.
column10: are legally required to yield the right of way to trains.

column2: 21. What should you do if your rear wheels start to skid?
column4: Steer left if your rear wheels slide right.
column6: Turn the steering wheel in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.
column8: If the vehicle has ABS, pump the pedal carefully.
column10: Take your foot off the gas and shift to neutral.

column2: 22. You are driving and you are feeling drowsy. You should:
column4: turn on the radio to keep you awake.
column6: have a beer or two to keep you awake.
column10: find a safe place to stop for a break.

column2: 23. When approaching a highway-rail intersection, the first sign drivers see is usually:
column10: an RXR round sign on a yellow background.

column2: 24. To drive defensively, you must:
column4: use only one hand on the wheel.
column6: not check behind you through your mirrors.
column8: assume that a driver who approaches a STOP sign on a side road is actually going to stop.

column2: 25. If you stop at a railroad crossing with more than one track:
column4: proceed with caution until you see a train.
column6: go through as soon as the first train passes.
column8: go through when one of the tracks is free.
column10: wait until you have a clear view of both tracks.

column2: 26. This road sign means:
27. This sign means:
column4: Do not to enter if your vehicle is taller than the height listed on the sign.
column8: Narrow bridge ahead. Slow down and drive with caution.

column2: 28. When changing lanes, you can check your blind spot by:
column4: turning your head and glancing over your shoulder.
column8: checking the rearview and outside mirrors.

column2: 29. What do pennant-shaped signs indicate?
30. If you stop along the road at night:
column6: turn off your emergency lights and leave your high beams on.
column8: turn on your emergency flashers and leave your low beams on.

column2: 31. To avoid becoming an aggressive driver, you should:
column4: Adjust your schedule to drive during times with the most highway traffic.
column6: Allow enough travel time to reach your destination on schedule.

column2: 32. Alcohol:
column6: makes it difficult for drivers to judge their condition.
column8: makes drivers more prone to take chances.

column2: 33. When driving at night, you should slow down and:
column4: come to a complete stop whenever there's oncoming traffic.
column6: use high beams whenever possible, but never when there's oncoming traffic.
column8: follow the vehicle ahead more closely to avoid glare from oncoming headlights.
column10: use high beams until other drivers dim their lights.

column2: 34. Which of the following must you obey over the others?
35. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: they can not safely return to the right lane before they reach a solid yellow center line for the right lane.
column6: they approach the top of a hill on a two-way road and can not see over it.
column8: they are within 100 feet of a railroad crossing on a two-way roadway.

column2: 36. BAC is expressed in:
column10: ounces of alcohol in your blood.

column2: 37. When driving in icy or snowy conditions, to avoid crashes drivers should:
column4: engage 4 wheel drive on the vehicle.
column6: get off the highway as quickly as possible.
column8: reduce speed and increase following distance.
column10: add extra weight to the vehicle to improve traction.

column2: 38. A thumping sound can be a warning:
column6: that a tire blowout is about to occur.

column2: 39. Drinking alcohol while taking drugs can:
column6: have a more pronounced effect than either taken separately.
column8: have a less pronounced effect than either taken separately.

column2: 40. You must come to a full stop at a yield sign:
column6: Before you decrease speed and reach the intersection.

column2: 41. You may not pass another vehicle on either side of a _______ centerline.
42. This sign means:
43. You should never depend on your mirrors when you prepare to change lanes. Why?
column8: Mirrors leave “blind spots” behind both sides of vehicles.
column10: You should look over your shoulder instead.

column2: 44. A 4-way stop sign means:
column4: The first vehicle to reach the intersection should move forward first.
column6: Traffic from all four directions must stop.
column8: There are four stop signs at the intersection.

column2: 45. This regulatory road sign indicates that:
column4: Slower vehicles traveling on multiple lane highways must stay in the right hand lane.
column8: Vehicles must slow down and stay in the right lane.
column10: The right hand lane is reserved for buses and car-pool vehicles.

column2: 46. Your BAC depends on:
column4: how much time passes between drinks.

column2: 47. A flashing red traffic light:
column4: indicates that you should drive with caution.
column6: is used to indicate a pedestrian crossing.
column8: has the same meaning as a yield sign.
column10: has the same meaning as a stop sign.

column2: 48. Parking is not allowed:
column4: within 300 feet of a pedestrian safety area.
column6: in an intersection, unless permitted by signs.
column10: within 250 feet of a traffic light.

column2: 49. This road sign means:
50. The traffic light is green and you want to drive straight through an intersection. If a car is already in the intersection and is making a turn, you must:
column4: let that car complete its turn before you enter the intersection.
column6: enter the intersection and then stop.
column8: wait for the next green light.
column10: drive through the intersection. You have the right-of-way.
